oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Lt. Gen. Jubal A. Early recommending Col. Peck for promotion to Brigadier General
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this handwritten note, Lt. Gen. Jubal Early attests to Peck's gallantry and efficiency as a cavalry officer and says he is "remarkable for his patriotic devotion to the cause of the Confederacy." By war's end Peck is made general rank. Early's cavalry command, with Col. Peck in his ranks, led one of the last Confederate offensive operations of the war, riding his troopers to within thirty miles or so of the enemy capital of Washington, D.C.
